alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued December 24 at 8:06AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Valdez Avalanche Center. ...THE VALDEZ AVALANCHE CENTER HAS ISSUED AN AVALANCHE WARNING FOR THE FOLLOWING AREAS: VALDEZ, THOMPSON PASS FROM NOW TO 6PM SUNDAY... * WHAT...The backcountry avalanche danger is HIGH. Very dangerous avalanche conditions exist. * WHERE...For the mountains surrounding the Valdez and Thompson Pass area. * WHEN...In effect through Sunday 6:00 PM AKST. * IMPACTS...A combination of heavy snowfall, strong winds and rising temperatures has created widespread areas of unstable snow. Large human triggered and natural avalanches are likely today. Avalanche debris may run into valley bottoms. * PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Travel in avalanche terrain is NOT recommended. Backcountry travelers should stay off of...and out from underneath slopes steeper than 30 degrees. Avalanches may run long distances. Similar avalanche danger may exist outside the area specified. For more information visit alaskasnow.org/valdez
